Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr. slides safely into second base ahead of the tag from Michael Massey during the seventh inning of Game 1 of the American League baseball division series.
Alex Verdugo followed with a run-scoring single that gave the New York Yankees the lead for good in a 6-5 win over the Kansas City Royals.
The game featured five lead changes, with the score tied at 5-5 when Chisholm singled against Michael Lorenzen leading off the seventh.
Post-Match Reflections: Royals manager Matt Quatraro expressed frustration over the replay decision, stating there was nothing clear and convincing to overturn the call.
Michael Massey reviewed the replays after the final out and found the video convincing that the tag was made.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. recalled the back-and-forth with Massey, maintaining confidence that he was safe.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the first postseason game with five lead changes.
MLB's replay regulations state the umpire in the control room has three options: confirm, change, or let stand the call on the field due to the lack of clear and convincing evidence to change it.
